alert.note: Alert for Forsyth; Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 05 at 2:19AM EST until February 06 at 12:08PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Big Creek near Alpharetta affecting Fulton and Forsyth Counties. For the Big Creek...including Alpharetta...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Creek near Alpharetta. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9 feet, Minor flooding expands along the creek from near Cumming to Alpharetta and Roswell. Backyards of homes off Seale Drive and Gunter Court and portions of the Golf of Georgia begin to flood. The Big Creek Greenway experiences significant flooding up to 3 feet deep...which results in closure of most of the paths. This especially occurs upstream and downstream from the gage on Kimball Bridge Road and Rock Mill Park. A large portion of the YMCA Campground off Preston Ridge Road will be under a foot of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 AM EST Saturday the stage was 8.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:00 AM EST Saturday was 8.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.8 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 7 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.8 feet on 04/14/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
